ygData.subject: AC is all that matters.

ygData.messageBody:
>> *grin* You can disagree all you like, but that's not going to change
>> the game.
> Fair enough; I firmly believe you're incorrect. See below.

*laugh* Firmly believe away, but please only do so after reading the rest
of this article.

> Ok, if AC is all that matters, why do a pair of characters at equal
> level and Defensive skills have such vast differences? One a Ranger in
> full banded, the other a Warrior/Paladin/ShadowKnight in full plate; the
> Rangers consistently take more damage from fights than their heavily
> armored fellow tanks.

Ok... have you actually looked at the AC advantage that Plate provides
over Banded? Have you actually _asked_ a Ranger in full Banded his AC and
then compared it to yours (assuming in full Plate)?

Here's the numbers. Armor sets add the following amount to your 'base' AC
from level/agility/defense skill. (Note that there are some modifying
effects. e.g., Armor provides more AC for characters with high (90+)
Agility.)

Full Plate: 110 AC
Full Banded: 77 AC

AC differential: 33 AC (not including modifying effects)

That is where the difference in damage arises, not from the type of armor.

If you were to replace all of these Plate pieces with Magical Leather
Armor that totalled up to 110AC you would receive the _exact_ same
protection as if you had Plate on (level and skill being equal).

> Still don't like that test? Try this one: take *your* WAR/PAL/SDK and
> get a full suit of plate to match the full suit of banded you're so
> proud of. Go fight a few blue mobs in your banded armor and note the
> strength of the blows that connect against you; how much single shots
> tend to do, how many low damage shots you receive, and how much total
> damage you take over the fight.

As noted above, your test is flawed because there is a serious AC
difference between the Banded and Plate. And I have tested both Plate and
Plate equivalents looking for differences. My Paladin, Warrior, and SK
all maximize AC per slot resulting in the greatest protection.

Admittedly, I do prefer the look of Steel Plate, but I will sacrifice it
in favor of better equipment (higher AC/stat enhancers) if the advantage
is significant enough.

Aside from AC differences, appearance of armor matters only for personal
aethestics.

> Now put on the plate and try another few fights against similar mobs
> (level and race). You should notice fewer shots dealing maximum damage
> against you, more shots doing low damage (2-10 where before it would
> have been 40-60 on each connect), and less total damage at the end of
> the fight.

As is _very_ correct, given that you're wearing 33 AC more.

> You think you've found some secret uber-combo (ala Tekken or something,
> up-up-down-left-right left and right punch together to produce the
> MegaFireball) or something; this game has shown no instances of such
> imbalances.

Whoa... whoa... whoa... nice shooting Tex...

What ultra-secret combo am I trying to reveal? I'm just saying that
AC is the deciding factor in determining protection during melee combat.

When did knowledge of the game you're playing become some cheat code?

> Do you truly think they managed to get all the way through four phases
> of beta and the past 4-6 months of final and never notice that plate, as
> you are alledging, is useless?

Plate is _not_ useless. It provides the most AC per piece available of
any armor that can be bought from standard NPC merchants. Therefore it is
the best protection you can get without adventuring. But that is _not_
because it is (insert angel choir here) Plate.

> Thinking you've found some hidden truth; that banded is marginally (5%
> or less) effective than Plate but has a fraction of the weight ...
> folly. Sheer folly.

*vast confusion* Where, in any of my mail, have I stated that Banded is
equivalent to Plate?

> Plate matters in a fight. I'll take plate armored tanks over those in
> banded seven days a week and the rest of the month too. I have watched
> the performance of Rangers (since they *can't* have better than banded)
> higher than my level for months now; they're stuck in banded while I'm
> in plate, and I take less damage when tanking. I've watched warriors
> who aren't plate armored yet, and I take less damage than they when
> tanking. And I only have an 80 AGI, so it's not that.

No... AC matters in a fight. I would take a L30 Warrior in full Azure
over a L30 Warrior in full Steel Plate any day of the week. Why? Because
Azure has a higher AC per piece and therefore provides more protection
than Plate.

BTW, Azure looks like Cloth armor.

> But hey, whatever you want to do. If you're in my group though, I won't
> appreciate the higher percentage of the healers' mana you'll be taking
> to recover from the greater damage you'll be taking. I suspect they
> won't either.

*grin* You won't have to "not appreciate it", because I won't be taking
the damage.

AC matters. Style (appearance) matters. Choose which one matters more.

In a fight, I know which one I would choose.

Hope this helps,

Drew
